effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Feel No Pain 4+ ability against Psychic attacks and mortal wounds.

lore: The Talons of the Emperor tear apart their prey.
whenRules: Start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: Up to two Adeptus Custodes units from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in one of your units targets an enemy unit that is below its Starting Strength, add 1 to the Wound roll.
restrictionRules: You can only select two units if one (and only one) of them is an Anathema Psykana unit and both are within 6" of each other.

lore: Every move the enemy makes only sees them fall.
whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: Up to two Adeptus Custodes units from your army that are within 9" of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Your units can make a Normal move of up to 6".
restrictionRules: You cannot select units that are within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units. You can only select two units if one (and only one) of them is an Anathema Psykana unit and both are within 6" of each other.

lore: It is second nature for Custodes to place themselves between their comrades and potential peril.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Anathema Psykana Infantry unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks, and one other friendly Adeptus Custodes Infantry unit (excluding Anathema Psykana units) within 6" of that Anathema Psykana Infantry unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, any attack that targets your Anathema Psykana unit must instead target your other Adeptus Custodes unit (unless it is not an eligible target).

lore: To overcome the Null Maidens’ aura, enemy psykers overstretch themselves with horrible consequences.
whenRules: Any phase, just after an enemy Psyker unit has either finished using a Psychic ability that targets a unit, or finished making Psychic Attacks.
targetRules: One Anathema Psykana unit from your army within 18" of that enemy Psyker unit.
effectRules: That enemy Psyker unit must take a Leadership test. If the test is passed, that Psyker unit is Battle‑shocked; if the test is failed that Psyker unit suffers 3 mortal wounds and is Battle‑shocked.

lore: Null Maidens train to slay psykers with swift martial efficiency, for they know their prey have many weapons beyond just their powers and must not be allowed time or opportunity to employ them.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Anathema Psykana unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Select either the [LETHAL HITS] or [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by models in your unit have the selected ability, but models in your unit can only target Psyker units with their attacks.

lore: The Vigilators train tirelessly in the art of the swift, beheading strike, with a particular emphasis on the swift elimination of enemy witches.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Vigilators unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a melee attack, you can re‑roll the Hit roll. If the target of that attack is Battle‑shocked or a Psyker, you can re‑roll the Wound roll as well.

lore: Prosecutors can fire psy‑chaff bolts whose esoteric emissions weaken those targets not slain outright.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Prosecutors unit from your army that has just shot.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the start of your next turn, while your unit is on the battlefield, that enemy unit is prosecuted. While a unit is prosecuted, each time an Anathema Psykana model makes an attack against that unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1. While a Psyker or Battle‑shocked unit is prosecuted, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

lore: Witchseekers know their role in combat is to spread indiscriminate carnage through the foe’s ranks.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Witchseekers unit from your army that  has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of Torrent weapons equipped by models in your unit. If such a weapon targets a Psyker or Battle‑shocked unit this phase, add 2 to its Attacks characteristic instead.

lore: Enemies must overcome disorienting waves of revulsion in order to even focus upon Null Maidens.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Anathema Psykana Infantry unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Stealth ability, and Battle‑shocked and Psyker models can only select your unit as a target of a ranged attack if they are within 12".

lore: What foe can withstand a warrior who has so tested the defences of the Throneworld itself?
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes Character unit from your army that has just destroyed the unit you selected at the start of your Command phase as the target of your Assemblage of Might ability.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit on the battlefield. Until the start of your next Command phase, each time an Adeptus Custodes Character model from your army makes an attack that target that enemy unit, add 1 to the Wound roll. In addition, if the destroyed unit was a Character unit, gain 1CP.

lore: The greatest of the Custodians bring incredible reserves of stamina and ability to bear.
whenRules: Any phase, just after an Adeptus Custodes Warlord model from your army has used an ability on its datasheet or from an Enhancement that says it can only be used ‘Once per battle'.
targetRules: That Adeptus Custodes Warlord model.
effectRules: Your model can use its ‘Once per battle' ability one additional time during this battle (but not in the same phase).
restrictionRules: You cannot use this Stratagem more than once per battle.

lore: In an age plagued by monsters, when primordial horrors from the darkest void circle Humanity’s dying light, still the Adeptus Custodes stand strong.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes Character unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, Character models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 4+ ability.

lore: To lay low the greatest and most terrible monsters and heretics is to earn new names for a Custodian’s mighty tally.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: Up to two Adeptus Custodes Character units from your army that have not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a Character model in either of your units makes an attack that targets a Monster or Vehicle unit, you can re‑roll the Hit roll and you can re‑roll the Wound roll.

lore: The Custodes do not yield while their duty remains unfulfilled.
whenRules: Fight Phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes Character model from your army that was just destroyed and has not fought this phase. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Do not remove your destroyed model from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: The greatest Custodians know when it is both their duty and their right to command their comrades.
whenRules: End of your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Custodes Character model from your army that is within 2" horizontally and 5" vertically of a friendly unit that it could lead (as described on the Leader section of its datasheet).
effectRules: That Character model attaches to that unit to form an Attached unit. Change the unit's Starting Strength accordingly.
restrictionRules: Your Character model cannot attach to a unit that is already an Attached unit.

lore: A haze of deadly radiation hangs around the warriors of the Rad-Cohort, every exhalation they make adding to the isotopic fog, sapping the strength and stamina of those who are not inured to its effects.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army (excluding Vehicle units) that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, each time an attack is made that targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

lore: As Tech-Priests order the purge of an area of the battlefield, rad-bombardments are redoubled in the hopes of turning it into a wasteland.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Tech-Priest model from your army and one objective marker within 24" of that model.
effectRules: Roll one D6 for each enemy unit within range of that objective marker. On a 4+, that unit suffers 1 mortal wound and it must take a Battle-shock test.

lore: Sanctified with the Tri-fold Litany, the most blessed power cells, fuel canisters and solid slugs have spent a decade in the oldest and most irradiated forge temple to certify their lethality.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit (excluding Vehicle units), add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: The Skitarii feel the press of an invisible hand upon their minds as the Machine God drives them forward. Servos are pushed to their structural limits as fibre bundles fill with the boundless energy of the Motive Force and propel the faithful on an unstoppable crusade.
whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Skitarii unit from your army that Advanced this turn.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to declare a charge even though it Advanced this turn.
restrictionRules: You can only use this Stratagem if the Conqueror Imperative is active for your army.

lore: The sentence for those who dare strike at the Tech-Priests’ holy creations has been carefully prepared in advance and it can be unleashed with an anger born of fanatical faith.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has resolved its attacks.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but it must target only that enemy unit when doing so, and it can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target. After your unit has finished making these attacks, it is not eligible to shoot again this turn.

lore: The warrior wisdom of experienced Reductors is force-loaded into the Skitarii’s minds. Each pulse of data bestows a sensation of sacred invulnerability upon the Tech-Priests’ soldiers.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Skitarii unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, models in your unit have a 4+ invulnerable save.
restrictionRules: You can only use this Stratagem if the Protector Imperative is active for your army.

lore: Intensifying the locomotive protocols of a war engine - while not dishonouring the machine spirit - is a millennia-proven method to hasten the foe’s demise.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus Vehicle unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, add 3" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit and add 1 to Advance and Charge rolls made for it.

lore: Encoded with the schemata of the enemy’s fortified battle lines and auto-codified vectors of attack, the Cohort’s war engines are perfectly aligned to deliver the Machine God’s wrath.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Legio Cybernetica or Adeptus Mechanicus Vehicle unit from your army, and one objective marker.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have a Ballistic Skill characteristic of 3+ and the [IGNORES COVER] ability, but they can only target units within range of the selected objective marker.

lore: To invigorate the failing machine spirit of a damaged vehicle is a sacred task, greatly aided by certain data-hymns transmitted in the correct sequence.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Legio Cybernetica or Adeptus Mechanicus Vehicle unit from your army that is below its Starting Strength.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll. If your unit is Below Half-strength, you can re-roll the Wound roll as well.

lore: Let the unenlightened be cast down! Let all feel the fire of the Motive Force, and may the sacred engines crunch over their weak bones without impediment!
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Legio Cybernetica or Adeptus Mechanicus Vehicle unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back and you can ignore any or all modifiers to its characteristics and/or to any roll or test made for it (excluding modifiers to saving throws).

lore: Enhanced static chants can briefly raise a war engine’s machine spirits to exultant heights of cogitation and multi-tactical capacity.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Legio Cybernetica or Adeptus Mechanicus Vehicle unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, the Conqueror Imperative and Protector Imperative are both active for your unit.

lore: A protective blessing chanted in pentakairic Novabyte moves machine spirits to defy the most esoteric of assaults.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Legio Cybernetica or Adeptus Mechanicus Vehicle unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability, which is improved to Feel No Pain 5+ against mortal wounds.

lore: Raising their voices in binharic praise, the Machine God’s disciples bolster their spirits - as well as those that inhabit their augmentations - with iron surely.
whenRules: Any phase, just after you allocate a mortal wound to a Cult Mechanicus model from your army.
targetRules: That Cult Mechanicus model's unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, Cult Mechanicus models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 4+ ability against mortal wounds.

lore: In spitting out a staccato chant to the Motive Force, the faithful warriors of the Cult Mechanicus are filled with merciless surety as well as intent.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Cult Mechanicus unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a Cult Mechanicus model in your unit makes a melee attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: Rousing code in binharic duometer incites fury for the lost fragments of technological lore. In the grip of vengeance, the devoted extend their remaining functions for one last act of retribution.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Cult Mechanicus unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a Cult Mechanicus model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6: on a 4+, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking model's unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: A cacophonous chorale pours from the emitters and augmented throats of the Cult Mechanicus’ faithful, venerating the Omnissiah in deafening and disconcerting frequencies of praise.
whenRules: Start of your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Cult Mechanicus unit from your army and one enemy unit within 18" of it.
effectRules: That enemy unit must take a Battle-shock test. If that test is failed, until the start of your next Command phase, each time a model in that enemy unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

lore: Summoning the spark of the Machine God’s divinity that burns within them, the Omnissiah’s faithful manifest blazing auras of energy that lay low the unbeliever.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Cult Mechanicus unit from your army.
effectRules: Roll one D6 for each enemy unit within 6" of one or more Cult Mechanicus models in your unit, adding 1 to the result if that model is an Electro-Priest. On a 5+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

lore: As the cohorts of the Omnissiah recite their dazzling consecration, energy is redirected to infuse masterwork bionics and even the lambent glow of protective fields ignites in a halo of divine defence.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Cult Mechanicus unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, Cult Mechanicus models in your unit have a 4+ invulnerable save.

lore: Death is irrelevant compared to the hallowed duty of securing the Omnissiah’s knowledge for future retrieval.
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army that was just destroyed while it was within range of an objective marker you controlled. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: That objective marker remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn.

lore: Retrieval of the most sacred and ancient fragments of technology is embedded in loops of alpha-logic.
whenRules: Fight phase, just before an Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army Consolidates.
targetRules: That Adeptus Mechanicus unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3", provided your unit ends that Consolidation move within range of your Acquisition objective marker.
restrictionRules: You cannot target a unit with this Stratagem if it is within 3" of one or more enemy units.

lore: Mono-task infoslave skulls range ahead to assess potential sites that must be investigated.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Tech-Priest model from your army and one objective marker within 24" of that model (excluding your Acquisition objective marker).
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, that objective marker is also considered to be one of your Acquisition objective markers for all rules purposes.

lore: With a surge of targeting data from the war engine as its hatches slam open, the warriors inside pour out with weapons already trained unerringly on the foe.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus unit from your army that disembarked from a Transport this turn.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit within range of your Acquisition objective marker, add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: The machine spirits of sanctified war engines can be entreated to release clouds of incense laced with radioactive particles, veiling the faithful from the foe.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus Infantry unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks, and one friendly Adeptus Mechanicus Smoke unit within 6" of it.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, both of those units have the Stealth ability and the Benefit of Cover.

lore: Holy data must be hoarded at all costs, and thickly armoured war engines offer swift and secure vaults.
whenRules: Your opponent's Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
targetRules: One Adeptus Mechanicus Infantry unit from your army within range of your Acquisition objective marker that was selected as a target of that charge, and one friendly Adeptus Mechanicus Transport.
effectRules: Your unit can embark within that Transport.
restrictionRules: Every model in your unit must be within 3" of that Transport and there must be sufficient transport capacity to embark the entire unit.

lore: Between their multi-layered bionics and their fanatical faith in the indomitability of these machine-blessings, the most augmented of Skitarii are nigh-impossible to lay low.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Sicarian, Pteraxii or Sydonian unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability.

lore: Employing directed binharic entanglement to coordinate their motions, paired squads of Skitarii attack with eerie and lethal synchronicity.
whenRules: The start of your Shooting phase or the start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: Two Skitarii units from your army that have not been selected to shoot or fight this phase, and one enemy unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of weapons equipped by models in both of your units by 1.
restrictionRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in either of your units makes an attack, it can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target).

lore: Binharic imperatives flash through neural architecture, driving augmetic muscle-bundles and auto-actuators into overdrive to propel the Skitarii more swiftly into the fray.
whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Skitarii unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

lore: The swiftest hunters seek to engage foes with the equations of war in their favour, isolating their quarry and dispatching it with ruthless efficiency.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Sicarian, Pteraxii, Sydonian, Ironstrider Ballistarii or Skitarii Mounted unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, if there are no other enemy units within 6" of the unit targeted by that attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: When Skitarii Hunter Cohorts march to war, they do so beneath a shrouding squall of cyber-static and filament-heavy banks of sacred incense.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Skitarii Infantry unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 12".

lore: Taking direct control of their cybernetic soldiers’ manoeuvres, the cohort’s commander sees their withdrawal carried out with such precision that they can be pressed back into service from the most efficacious of attack vectors.
whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: Up to two Sicarian units from your army, or one Skitarii Infantry or Skitarii Mounted unit from your army.
effectRules: Remove those units from the battlefield and place them into Strategic Reserves.
restrictionRules: Each unit targeted with this Stratagem must be more than 3" away from all enemy units.

lore: The belligerence and transhuman physiologies of the Deathwatch make them unyielding foes.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Deathwatch unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Only a truly versatile approach to warfare allows the Deathwatch to focus their tactical genius and best the myriad xenos foes they face.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Deathwatch unit from your army.
effectRules: Select the Furor Tactics, Malleus Tactics or Purgatus Tactics. Until the start of your next Command phase, that Deathwatch Mission Tactic is active for your unit instead of any other Deathwatch Mission Tactic that is active for your army, even if you have already selected that Deathwatch Mission Tactic this battle.

lore: Hellfire rounds contain reservoirs of virulent bio-acids that eat away the flesh of their victims in seconds and leave nothing but bubbling gruel.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Deathwatch Infantry unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons (excluding Devastating Wounds weapons) equipped by models in your unit have the [ANTI-INFANTRY 2+] and [ANTI-MONSTER 5+] abilities.
restrictionRules: You cannot select any units that have already been targeted with either the Kraken Rounds or Dragonfire Rounds Stratagems this phase.

lore: Dragonfire rounds are designed to explode just before contact, saturating foes in cover with searing gas and flames.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Deathwatch Infantry unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [ASSAULT] and [IGNORES COVER] abilities.
restrictionRules: You cannot select any units that have already been targeted with either the Kraken Rounds or Hellfire Rounds Stratagems this phase.

lore: Kraken rounds utilise adamantine cores and improved propellants to penetrate the thickest hide.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Deathwatch Infantry unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1 and improve the Range characteristic of those weapons by 6".
restrictionRules: You cannot select any units that have already been targeted with either the Dragonfire Rounds or Hellfire Rounds Stratagems this phase.

lore: The Ordo Xenos and Deathwatch alike have access to swift gunships and landers that allow for hasty repositioning in the midst of battle.
whenRules: End of your opponent's Fight phase.
targetRules: One Inquistor or Deathwatch Infantry unit from your army.
effectRules: Remove your unit from the battlefield. In the Reinforcements step of your next Movement phase, set your unit up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy models.
restrictionRules: You cannot select a unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

lore: Emitting blasts of light, sound and blinding smoke, these devices disorient the foe.
whenRules: Start of any phase (excluding the Command phase).
targetRules: One Adeptus Arbites, Inquisitorial Agents or Ordo Hereticus Grenades unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit (excluding Monsters or Vehicles) within 8" of and visible to your unit. That enemy unit must take a Battle-shock test and, until the end of the phase, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

lore: Agents of the Ordo Hereticus are unmerciful in meting out what they see as the Emperor’s justice.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Arbites, Inquisitorial Agents or Ordo Hereticus unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

lore: These warriors defend the sanctity of the Emperor’s realm with unwavering determination, no matter the odds stacked against them.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Arbites, Inquisitorial Agents or Ordo Hereticus Infantry unit from your army within range of an objective marker and that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability.

lore: There can be no mercy for heretic leaders.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Arbites, Inquisitorial Agents or Ordo Hereticus Infantry unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one enemy Character unit on the battlefield. Until the start of your next Command phase, each time a model in your unit targets that Character unit, its weapons have the [PRECISION] ability.

lore: These ruthless warriors will risk firing into their own ranks if it ensures the deaths of heretics.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Arbites, Inquisitorial Agents or Ordo Hereticus unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit can target enemy units that are within Engagement Range of one or more friendly units with ranged weapons (excluding Blast weapons), provided the target is within 12".

lore: Vengeance is swift and unforgiving for those who attack the servants of the Emperor.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an Agents of the Imperium unit from your army is destroyed as the result of an enemy unit's attacks.
targetRules: One Adeptus Arbites, Inquisitorial Agents or Ordo Hereticus unit from your army that was within 6" of the destroyed unit (you cannot target the destroyed unit with the Stratagem).
effectRules: After the attacking unit has shot, your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but when resolving those attacks it can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target).

lore: Whether sanctifying the battlefield against heresy or binding sinister guardian entities to keep watch, this ritual extends its practitioner’s strategic influence.
whenRules: Start of any Command phase.
targetRules: One Inquisitor, Inquisitorial Agents or Ordo Malleus unit from your army that is within range of an objective marker you control.
effectRules: That objective marker is said to be Warded and remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn. While an objective marker is Warded and under your control, enemy Daemon units cannot be set up on the battlefield within 6" of it.

lore: With the correct words of abjuration and banishment, daemons can be driven out of realspace and back into the warp.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Inquisitor, Inquisitorial Agents or Ordo Malleus unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one enemy Daemon unit within 12" and visible to your unit. That unit must take a Battle-shock test. If that test is failed, then until the end of the phase, each time a friendly Agents of the Imperium unit makes an attack that targets that Daemon unit, that attack has the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.

lore: The battle-brothers of the Grey Knights never flee from their daemonic foes, instead merely withdrawing momentarily before striking anew.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a Grey Knights Terminator Squad unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That Grey Knights Terminator Squad unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

lore: Grey Knights battle plate incorporates litanies of purity, strands of sanctified silver and other sacred wards, whose defences can be further empowered by ritual mantras.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Grey Knights Terminator Squad unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Ancient warding sigils inscribed in shimmering silver, these strange runic designs ward away the hostile energies of the warp.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Ordo Malleus unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, all Psychic weapons equipped by models in the attacking unit have the [HAZARDOUS] ability.

lore: Specially consecrated and silver-tipped, these bolt shells channel the firer’s innate psychic fury and detonate spectacularly on impact.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Grey Knights Terminator Squad unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LETHAL HITS] and [PSYCHIC] abilities.

lore: If a high-ranking Imperial agent locates something they wish to acquire, nothing will stop them from unleashing all the forces at their command to seize it.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Agents of the Imperium unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit within range of an objective marker, that attack has the [SUSTAINED HITS 1], [LANCE] and [IGNORES COVER] abilities.

lore: With command of the orbital engagement zone comes the ability to strike at the enemy from unexpected angles.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Voidfarers Character unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each Agents of the Imperium unit from your army that is arriving from Strategic Reserves this turn can be set up within your opponent's deployment zone (all other restrictions still apply).

lore: Soldiers trained in shipboard warfare and chamber-by-chamber clearance know how best to focus their firepower during close-range firefights.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Voidfarers unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets a unit within 12", improve the Strength and Armour Penetration characteristics of that attack by 1.

lore: Believing they fight for the safety of the Golden Throne motivates warriors to exceptional deeds.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Agents of the Imperium unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced or Fell Back.

lore: These rare protective fields perform microteleport displacements to remove their bearers from harm.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Agents of the Imperium Character unit from your army (excluding Officio Assassinorum units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have a 4+ invulnerable save and, after the attacking unit has resolved its attacks, unless your unit is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move of up to 6" (when doing so, models in this unit move as if they have the Fly keyword).

lore: Loyal Imperial warriors will martyr themselves gladly to protect high-ranking Imperial agents.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Agents of the Imperium Attached unit that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack with the [PRECISION] ability is allocated to a Character model in your unit, if there are one or more Bodyguard models in your unit, roll one D6: on a 2+, that attack is allocated to a Bodyguard model of your choice in your unit instead.

lore: The Aeldari can process battlefield events at baffling speed, making their physical reactions so fast that they are able to dodge attacks that would hit any other target.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Aeldari unit from your army (excluding Wraith Construct units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

lore: The Aeldari are forever elusive, and their actions are unpredictable and deceptive. What appears to be a full retreat one moment is revealed as the prelude to a devastating attack the next.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after an Aeldari unit from your army makes a Fall Back move.
targetRules: That Aeldari unit.
effectRules: Your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge this turn even though it Fell Back.

lore: Grace in battle and merciless efficiency are prized virtues in craftworld armies. Like the shimmering blades of Khaine, the Asuryani carve through the ranks of their enemies.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Aeldari unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, if your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.

lore: The Aeldari are masters of hit-and-run tactics, engaging a target with a flurry of shots before quickly manoeuvring into cover or out of sight.
whenRules: End of your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Aeldari unit from your army.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move. It cannot embark within a Transport at the end of this move.
restrictionRules: You cannot select an Aircraft unit or a unit within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, and until the end of the turn, the unit you selected is not eligible to declare a charge.

lore: The well-trained Aeldari are able to lay down a hail of fire from their weapons, their superior reflexes allowing them to track even the most sudden movement and place every shot perfectly.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Aeldari unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, on a Critical Wound, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 2.

lore: The Aeldari are masters of misdirection, and they employ holo-emitters and psychic phantasms to fool enemy scouts.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s Movement phase.
targetRules: One Aeldari Infantry unit from your army.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6". It cannot embark within a Transport at the end of this move.
restrictionRules: You cannot select a unit within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, and until the end of the turn, you cannot target that unit with the Heroic Intervention Stratagem.

lore: The Astra Militarum can call upon a nearly inexhaustible supply of warriors.
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One Regiment unit from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Add a new unit to your army identical to your destroyed unit, in Strategic Reserves, at its Starting Strength and with all of its wounds remaining.
restrictionRules: This Stratagem cannot be used to return destroyed Character units to Attached units.

lore: Astra Militarum combat doctrine utilises the concentration of focused firepower to hammer the foe from multiple angles.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Regiment or Squadron unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: After your unit has resolved its attacks, select one enemy unit that was targeted by one or more of those attacks. Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is made against that enemy unit by a Regiment or Squadron model from your army, unless the attacking unit is Battle-shocked, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Ordered to focus a rapid and repeated volley of fire, soldiers are able to rattle even the staunchest foe with a blizzard of shots.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Astra Militarum Infantry unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase, and one enemy unit (excluding Monsters and Vehicles).
effectRules: If your Astra Militarum unit scores one or more hits against that enemy unit this phase, until the end of your opponent’s next turn, each time a model in that enemy unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

lore: Skilled in coordinating their targeting with forward spotter elements, this regiment’s artillery crews are capable of devastating precision shelling.
whenRules: Start of your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Astra Militarum unit from your army equipped with a vox-caster, and one enemy unit that is visible to that unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an Astra Militarum model from your army makes an attack with an Indirect Fire weapon that targets that enemy unit, unless the attacking model is Battle-shocked, add 1 to the Hit roll.

lore: This officer is known for their strategic excellence, as are those they command. Honed over many years, their curt, well-established battle cant is wielded with consummate efficiency, reinforced by the inspirational example they themselves set.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Command phase.
targetRules: One Astra Militarum Officer unit from your army.
effectRules: Your Officer can issue one Order as if it were your Command phase.
restrictionRules: Your Officer cannot issue that Order to a Battle-shocked unit.

lore: The tanks of the Imperial Guard are armoured not only in reinforced plas-steel, but with devout faith in the Emperor and utter contempt for their foes.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Astra Militarum Vehicle unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

lore: The belligerency and transhuman physiologies of the Adeptus Astartes make them unyielding foes.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: The Black Templars channel their fervour into a hate-fuelled flurry of blows.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a melee attack, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1. If the Suffer Not The Unclean to Live vow is active for your army, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of that attack as well.

lore: Every blow struck against a Black Templar is answered in kind. Even as they are laid low, their blades still lash out at the enemies of the divine Emperor.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if the Uphold the Honour of the Emperor vow is active for your army. On a 4+, do not remove the destroyed model from play; it can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: The magnetic force of this Black Templar’s oratory inspires his fellow warriors to swear great vows, even in the midst of the battle.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Character unit from your army.
effectRules: Select one Templar Vow that is not active for your army. Until the start of your next Command phase, while that Character is leading a unit, models in that unit gain the benefits of that vow in addition to the vow selected to be active for your army at the start of the battle.

lore: Glowing blades and revving chainswords close off the foe’s every avenue of escape.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Movement phase, when an enemy unit (excluding Vehicles and Monsters) is selected to Fall Back.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if the Accept Any Challenge, No Matter the Odds vow is active for your army. On a 4+, that enemy unit cannot Fall Back this phase and must Remain Stationary. Otherwise, that enemy unit can Fall Back this phase, but if it does, all models in that unit must take a Desperate Escape test.

lore: With a zealous cry, the Black Templars press forward towards victory.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that had one or more of its models destroyed as a result of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6", but it must end that move closer to the enemy unit that just shot. If the Abhor the Witch, Destroy the Witch vow is active for your army, your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6" instead, but it must end that move either closer to the enemy unit that just shot, or closer to the closest enemy Psyker unit.

lore: The Blood Angels would gladly put themselves in harm’s way to protect others, exemplifying the sacrifice of Sanguinius.
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes Character unit from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: Until the end of the battle, each time a friendly Adeptus Astartes unit makes an attack that targets the enemy unit that just destroyed your Character unit, you can re-roll the Hit roll.

lore: The belligerency of the Adeptus Astartes combined with their transhuman physiology makes them unyielding foes to face.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: The Sons of Sanguinius constantly push towards new foes, the bloodlust singing in their veins unleashed in a controlled dynamism.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army, just before that unit Consolidates.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3", provided your unit ends that Consolidation move in Unit Coherency and within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

lore: In times of great desperation, fury and ferocity can be a warrior’s strongest allies.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LANCE] and [LETHAL HITS] abilities.

lore: Imminent death does not prevent a Space Marine from enacting his final justice upon the enemies of the Imperium.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Adeptus Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: Blood Angels are loathe to resort to the defensive strategies favoured by other Chapters, and a tactical withdrawal is but a prelude to re-entering the fray.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after an Adeptus Astartes unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That Adeptus Astartes unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to declare a charge even though it Fell Back this phase.

lore: Daemons instinctively feel the need to despoil and corrupt every corner of realspace, the better to sustain their otherworldly forms.
whenRules: Start of any Command phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica unit from your army that is within range of an objective marker you control.
effectRules: That objective marker is said to be Corrupted and remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn. In addition, while an objective marker is Corrupted and under your control, the area of the battlefield within 6" of that objective marker is considered to be within your army’s Shadow of Chaos.

lore: The swelling fear of their mortal prey serves as an intoxicating elixir to the daemonic followers, each draught invigorating their forms with deadly power.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of weapons equipped by models in that unit by 1. In addition, until the end of the phase, each time such a weapon targets a unit that is Battle-shocked, you can re-roll the Wound roll.

lore: The winds of the warp blow strong, invigorating daemonkind and lending them supernatural speed and ferocity.
whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica unit from your army that is within your army’s Shadow of Chaos.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge even if it Advanced this turn.

lore: Ever lurking in the warp, daemons will wait until the barriers between realms thin before tearing their way into realspace.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica unit from your army that is arriving using the Deep Strike ability this phase.
effectRules: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 3" horizontally away from all enemy models.
restrictionRules: A unit targeted by this Stratagem is not eligible to declare a charge in the same turn.

lore: When the energies of the warp bleed into realspace, the Legiones Daemonica can rip open portals in seeming thin-air, returning to their hellscapes only to rematerialise amidst their foes a heartbeat later.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s turn.
targetRules: Up to two Legiones Daemonica units from your army that are within your army’s Shadow of Chaos, or one other Legiones Daemonica unit from your army.
effectRules: Remove the targeted units from the battlefield and place them into Strategic Reserves. They will arrive back on the battlefield in the Reinforcements step of your next Movement phase using the Deep Strike ability.
restrictionRules: You cannot target units that are within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units with this Stratagem.

lore: Daemons are madness given form. Their very bodies are fashioned from the stuff of the warp, and are difficult to destroy through conventional means.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Legiones Daemonica unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an invulnerable saving throw is made for a model in your unit, re-roll a saving throw of 1.

lore: War Dog pilots encircle their terrified victims then attack in a ferocious mass.
whenRules: The start of your Shooting phase or the start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: Two or more War Dog units from your army and one enemy unit that is an eligible target for each of those selected War Dog units.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, the selected War Dog units can only target that enemy unit, but all weapons equipped by those War Dog models gain the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. In addition, if that enemy unit is Battle-shocked, until the end of the phase, each time a selected War Dog model makes an attack against that enemy unit, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

lore: Chaos Knight pilots refuse to yield while foes remain to be slain, disdainfully ignoring those who succumb to fear.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Chaos Knights unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your model has the Feel No Pain 6+ ability, and the Feel No Pain 5+ ability against attacks made by Battle-shocked models.

lore: Shrieking with ghoulish hunger, daemonic entities descend in a tatterwinged whirlwind to rend apart the souls of those enemies who show even a moment’s fear. The soul-raptors tear apart their victims’ animus and, as they feed, this life force is channelled to regenerate the battle damage or heal the pilot of the Knight in which these creatures roost.
whenRules: Any phase, just after an enemy unit fails a Battle-shock test.
targetRules: One Chaos Knights unit from your army that is within 12" of that enemy unit.
effectRules: Roll six D6. For each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound and this model regains up to 1 lost wound.

lore: The War Dogs of the Chaos Knights are more terrified of their lords than they are the enemy, and they heed their masters well, for they know the price of disobedience or disloyalty.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Abhorrent model from your army and up to three War Dog models from your army.
effectRules: Until the start of your next Command phase, those War Dog models count as being within range of any Aura abilities that Abhorrent model has.

lore: Like dark phantoms, some Chaos Knights can move through solid walls without hindrance.
whenRules: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
targetRules: Up to two War Dog models from your army or one Titanic Chaos Knights model from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, the selected models can move horizontally through models and terrain features as if they were not there.

lore: Ectoplasmic blood surges hot through glowing conduits as the Chaos Knight feeds power to its shield emitters.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Chaos Knights unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, that Chaos Knights model has a 4+ invulnerable save against ranged attacks.

lore: With gruesome offerings and ritualised promises, the Chaos Space Marines seek the protection of their infernal masters.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Fervent mortal followers flock to the champions of Chaos, damning their souls seeking promises of dark power.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Chaos Undivided unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can re-roll the Wound roll.

lore: Heretic Astartes are fuelled by hate, a searing spite that burns fiercely within them unto the very moment of death. Even as their life force pours from terrible wounds, this loathing can drive them to fight on in a second wind of wrath. Those Heretic Astartes in thrall to the Blood God feel this enmity to an even greater extent than others, exploding with violence just as the enemy think they have finally ended them.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if it is a Khorne unit: on a 4+, do not remove it from play. That destroyed model can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: With the Dark Gods and the powers of the warp on their side, Chaos Space Marines can cheat death altogether. Their foes look on in horror as killing wounds knit themselves together in a cacophony of hideous cracks and squelches and shattered armour reforms. After such a blessing, the Heretic Astartes are both something far greater, and far less, than what they once were.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army.
effectRules: One model in your unit regains up to 3 lost wounds. In addition, if your unit is a Tzeentch unit below its Starting Strength, one destroyed model (excluding Character models) is returned to your unit with its full wounds remaining.

lore: Some Heretic Astartes appear to move with a speed that should be impossible, weapons and bodies seemingly moving from one place to another in the blink of an eye.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back. In addition, if your unit is a Slaanesh unit, until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

lore: Choking fogs echoing with the screams of tortured souls; dense clouds of bloated flies; deluges of bloody rain; whirlwinds of coruscating flames blazing in a thousand hues. Such warp-born phenomena can appear on the battlefield in an instant, and disappear just as quickly. All serve to obscure the Heretic Astartes from their terrified foes.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Stealth ability. In addition, if your unit is a Nurgle unit, until the end of the phase, your unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18".

lore: No amount of bloodshed can truly satisfy this bitter champion’s desire for vengeance.
whenRules: Any phase, just after your focus of hatred is destroyed.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Character unit from your army (excluding Damned units).
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within 12" of and visible to your unit. Until the start of your next Command phase, that enemy unit is considered to be your focus of hatred.

lore: Such embittered warriors as these shrug off hails of enemy fire with arrogant disdain.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army (excluding Damned units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: Fearful of countenance, these ancient warriors are redolent with warp power and radiate a horrifying aura of might.
whenRules: Start of the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army (excluding Damned units) that is within Engagement Range of your focus of hatred.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Fights First ability.

lore: The Warmaster’s Black Crusade grinds ever onwards without restraint or remorse.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry unit or Heretic Astartes Mounted unit from your army (excluding Damned units).
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced or Fell Back, and bolt pistols, boltguns and combi-bolters equipped by models in your unit have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability while your unit has not already inflicted 6 wounds this turn using that ability.

lore: No barricade or fortification is proof against the vengeful fury of these hate-fuelled murderers.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army (excluding Tzeentch units) that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [IGNORES COVER] ability, and change the Attacks characteristic of Torrent weapons equipped by models in your unit to 6.

lore: Thousands of years of ceaseless conflict have forged these warriors into skilled and merciless killers.
whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry or Heretic Astartes Mounted unit from your army (excluding Damned units) that is within 9" of that enemy unit and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".

lore: These warriors employ expert saboteurs who utilise melta charges and improvised explosives to sow destruction.
whenRules: Any phase, just after an enemy model with the Deadly Demise ability (excluding Titanic models) is destroyed.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Character unit from your army that was within 18" of that enemy model when it was destroyed.
effectRules: Your opponent does not roll to determine whether mortal wounds are inflicted by their model's Deadly Demise ability. Instead, mortal wounds are automatically inflicted (if that ability inflicts a random number of mortal wounds, your opponent rolls to determine that number as normal).

lore: When the assault comes, it does so swiftly and without warning.
whenRules: Start of your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, add 1 to Charge rolls made for your unit for each other Heretic Astartes unit from your army that made a Charge move this phase (to a maximum of +3).

lore: The Heretic Astartes are pitiless reavers, targeting weak points in the enemy line with ruthless efficiency.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit that is below its Starting Strength, you can re-roll the Hit roll. If the target is Below Half-strength, you can re-roll the Wound roll as well.

lore: Some Heretic Astartes are masters of deceit, often feigning retreat only to open fire from close range.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a Heretic Astartes unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That Heretic Astartes unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Fell Back.

lore: These warriors stalk their assigned target with dogged determination, reacting to their every move.
whenRules: Your opponent's Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry or Heretic Astartes Mounted unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".

lore: Employing fell techno-sorcery, the Heretic Astartes disrupt enemy navigational cogitators and scramble teleporter beacons.
whenRules: Start of the Reinforcements step of your opponent's Movement phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, enemy units that are set up on the battlefield from Reserves cannot be set up within 12" horizontally of your unit.

lore: Such is their determination to claim their due that these warriors will gladly weather a storm of fire.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army (excluding Damned units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: If the bounty is to be claimed, the foe must first be purged.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit within range of an objective marker, that attack has the [PRECISION] ability.

lore: Mobility is the key to victory. These Heretic Astartes raiders outmanoeuvre outflank the foe in order to achieve victory.
whenRules: End of the Fight phase
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that was eligible to fight this phase.
effectRules: If your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move of up to 6" or up to 12" if it is a Mounted unit. Otherwise, your unit can make a Fall Back move. It cannot embark within a Transport at the end of this move if it disembarked from a Transport this turn.

lore: The engines of this vehicle or construct crackle with the row energies of the immaterium, propelling it forward at incredible speed.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Transport or Heretic Astartes Mounted unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, if your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.

lore: Utilising their swift transports, these ravagers plunge through the enemy lines to assault key positions.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or your Fight phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that disembarked from a Transport this turn and has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, if the target of that attack is within range of an objective marker, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.

lore: The prospect of riches spurs these renegade warriors forwards. Woe betide any in their path.
whenRules: Your Charge phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry or Heretic Astartes Mounted unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced. If you select one or more units within range of an objective marker as a target of that charge, add 1 to the Charge roll.

lore: Terror troops such as these inflict agonies upon their victims with malicious relish, targeting the weakened and wounded without pity.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit that is Battle-shocked and/or Below Half-strength, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: The violent and bloody slaughter of the enemy’s leadership hurls their followers into object panic.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after a Heretic Astartes unit from your army destroys a Character unit.
targetRules: That Heretic Astartes unit.
effectRules: Each enemy unit within 12" of and visible to your unit must take a Battle-shock test.

lore: These predatory warriors sense weakness as the hydrashark smells blood, sating their bloodlust upon the fearful and wounded.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit that is Battle-shocked and/or Below Half-strength, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.

lore: These warriors strike in screaming waves, each charge as brutal as the last.
whenRules: Your Movement phase, just after a Heretic Astartes Infantry unit from your army Falls Back.
targetRules: That Heretic Astartes Infantry unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a tum in which it Fell Back.

lore: Jump pack borne warriors descend from the skies, terrifying screams emanating from their vax-grllles as they plummet towards their prey.
whenRules: Reinforcements step of your Movement phase, from the second battle round onwards.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Jump Pack unit from your army that is in Reserves.
effectRules: Set your unit up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 3" horizontally away from all enemy units, but until the end of the turn, it is not eligible to declare a charge. Then select one enemy Infantry or Mounted unit within 6" of and visible to your unit: that unit must take a Battle-shock test.

lore: The Heretic Astartes allow none to flee the battle, pursuing their broken foes with relentless savagery.
whenRules: End of your opponent's Movement phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit that Fell Back this turn and is within 6" of your unit. Your unit can declare a charge as if it were your Charge phase. When doing so, you can only select that enemy unit as the target of that charge (and only if it is an eligible target). Note that even if this charge is successful, your unit does not receive any Charge bonus this turn.

lore: These iron-willed warriors refuse to retreat, even in the face of overwhelming odds. Mounting losses serve only to drive them forward.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more attacks this phase and has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll, and if your unit is Below Half-strength you can re-roll the Wound roll as well.

lore: These implacable soldiers weather the enemy’s fury before striking back in kind, to devastating effect.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Infantry unit from your army (excluding Damned units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a melee attack is allocated to your unit, after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, roll one D6 (to a maximum of six D6 per attacking unit): for each 4+, the attacking unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

lore: These warriors focus their ire upon a wounded foe, combining fire to fell their target in a cavalcade of destructive force.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit that is Below Half-strength, a successful unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.

lore: Even in the press of combat, the Heretic Astartes bring heavy weapons to bear, shattering fortifications and obliterating enemy infantry.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and has not been selected to shoot this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit's ranged weapons (excluding Blast weapons) have the [PISTOL] ability.

lore: These warriors possess endless endurance and are capable of weathering untold hardships in order to destroy their foes.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army (excluding Damned units) that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability.

lore: Veterans of countless grinding sieges, these Heretic Astartes repel and pin down wave after wave of foes with rapid boltgun fire and accurate artillery.
whenRules: Start of your opponent's Charge phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an enemy unit selects your unit as a target of a charge, subtract 2 from the Charge roll (this is not cumulative with any other negative modifiers to that Charge roll).

lore: The eyes of the Dark Gods fall upon those who slaughter in their name.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after a Heretic Astartes Character unit from your army (excluding Damned, Daemon and Epic Hero units) destroys an enemy unit.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Character model in that unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the battle, add 1 to the Move, Toughness and Wounds characteristics of that Character model, and add 1 to the Attacks, Strength and Damage characteristics of that Character models melee weapons.

lore: The Blood God’s thirst can never be slaked.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if it is a Khorne unit: on a 4+, do not remove it from play. That destroyed model can fight after the attacking model's unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

lore: Those Heretic Astartes sworn to the service of the Dark Gods display zeal through violence.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes Chaos Undivided unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can re-roll the Wound roll.

lore: Those who offer praise to the God of Change may gain the benefits of his mutagenic powers.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army.
effectRules: One model in your unit regains up to 3 lost wounds. In addition, if your unit is a Tzeentch unit below its Starting Strength, one destroyed model (excluding Character models) is returned to your unit with its full wounds remaining.

lore: As these warriors traverse the battlefield, an unnatural symphony of hypnotic music accompanies their every move, stupefying their enemies.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army.
effectRules: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back. If your unit is a Slaanesh unit, until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced or Fell Back.

lore: A roiling storm of warp energy obscures the Heretic Astartes, leaving their foes shooting at indistinct shadows.
whenRules: Your opponent's Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Heretic Astartes unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Stealth ability. In addition, if your unit is a Nurgle unit, it can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18".

lore: Within the massed ranks of a heretic cult, only a few are marked for greatness.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
targetRules: One Damned unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Desperate Pact. If it does, until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll, and if your unit did not fail the resulting Leadership test when making that Desperate Pact, you can re-roll the Wound roll as well.

lore: The zealous followers of the Dark Gods are devoted to the last. As death comes they strike a desperate final blow in hope of reward.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Damned unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit's attacks.
effectRules: Until the attacking unit has resolved all of its attacks, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, roll one D6: on a 6, the attacking unit suffers 1 mortal wound after all of its attacks have been resolved.

lore: Those in thrall to the Dark Gods will gladly sacrifice their lives to draw the eye of their darkling patrons.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One Damned unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Your unit can make a Desperate Pact.
