targetRules: One SYNAPSE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

lore: At need, the focused will of the Tyranid leader-beasts can goad warrior organisms to exhibit strategically beneficial behaviours at the instant they are needed most.
whenRules: Your Command phase.
targetRules: One TYRANIDS unit from your army that is within Synapse Range of your army.
effectRules: Select one Synaptic Imperative, even if you have already selected that imperative this battle. Until the start of your next Command phase, that Synaptic Imperative is active for your unit instead of any other Synaptic Imperative that is active for your army.

lore: The seemingly omniscient Hive Mind processes the sensory input of its swarms at an impossible rate, and compels its broods to react accordingly.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One TYRANIDS unit from your army that is within Synapse Range of your army and made a Fall Back move this phase.
effectRules: Your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge this turn.

lore: Those who witness the massacres inflicted by the World Eaters flee to avoid being the next victims.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One World Eaters unit from your army that made a Charge move this turn and destroyed one or more enemy units this phase.
effectRules: In your opponent’s next Command phase, each enemy unit within 6" of your unit must take a Battle-shock test. If the unit taking that test is Below Half-strength, subtract 1 from that test. Enemy units affected by this Stratagem do not need to take any other Battle-shock tests in the same phase.

lore: Khorne rewards those who test their might against the strongest foes, blessing the greatest warriors with his favour.
whenRules: Fight phase.
targetRules: One World Eaters unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a melee attack that targets a Character, Monster or Vehicle unit, add 1 to the Wound roll.

lore: When blood spills, the blessings of the Blood God are bountiful.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after a World Eaters unit from your army destroys an enemy unit.
targetRules: That World Eaters unit.
effectRules: Make a Blessings of Khorne roll. You can use the results of this roll to activate one Blessing of Khorne. That Blessing of Khorne does not count towards your maximum number of activated Blessings of Khorne, but all other rules for Blessings of Khorne apply.

lore: Khorne cares not from whence the blood flows, so long as it flows, and mere flesh wounds will not stay the wrath of the World Eaters.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One World Eaters unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

lore: The blood of Khorne’s devoted warriors is still blood, and when the battleground runs red, it is still a worthy addition to the Blood God’s domain.
whenRules: Any phase.
targetRules: One World Eaters unit from your army that was just destroyed while it was within range of an objective marker you controlled. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
effectRules: That objective marker remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at the start or end of any turn.

lore: Those who fight for Khorne are driven to even greater depths of rage, surging towards the foe in a barely controlled tide.
whenRules: Your Movement phase.
targetRules: One World Eaters unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, if your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.

lore: Indifferent to their own survival, these warriors hold their ground against seemingly impossible odds.
whenRules: Battle-shock step of your Command phase, just before you take a Battle-shock test for a unit from your army (pg 11).
targetRules: That unit from your army.
effectRules: Your unit automatically passes that Battle-shock test.
restrictionRules: You cannot use this Stratagem more than once per battle.

lore: In close-quarters combat, the slightest hesitation can leave an opening for a swift foe to exploit.
whenRules: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has fought.
targetRules: One unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units and that has not already been selected to fight this phase.
effectRules: Your unit fights next.

lore: A great commander can bend even the vagaries of fate and fortune to their will, the better to ensure victory.
whenRules: Any phase, just after you make an Advance roll, a Charge roll, a Desperate Escape test or a Hazardous test for a unit from your army, or a Hit roll, a Wound roll, a Damage roll or a saving throw for a model in that unit, or a roll to determine the number of attacks made with a weapon equipped by a model in that unit. If you are using fast dice rolling (pg 24), this Stratagem can still be used after  rolling multiple rolls or saving throws at once.
targetRules: That unit or model from your army.
effectRules: You re-roll that roll, test or saving throw. If you are using fast dice rolling, select one of those rolls or saving throws to re-roll.

lore: The legends of the 41st Millennium are replete with deadly duels between mighty champions.
whenRules: Fight phase, when a Character unit from your army that is within Engagement Range of one or more Attached units is selected to fight.
targetRules: One Character model in your unit.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, all melee attacks made by that model have the [PRECISION] ability.

lore: Priming their hand-held projectiles, these warriors draw back and hurl death into the enemy’s midst.
whenRules: Your Shooting phase.
targetRules: One Grenades unit from your army (excluding units that Advanced, Fell Back or have shot this turn) that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units
effectRules: Select one Grenades model in your unit and one enemy unit that is not within Engagement Range of one or more units from your army and is within 8" of and visible to your Grenades model. Roll six D6: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

lore: Ramming the foe with a speeding vehicle may be an unsubtle tactic, but it is a murderously effective one.
whenRules: Your Charge phase, just after a Vehicle unit from your army ends a Charge move
targetRules: That Vehicle unit.
effectRules: Select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of your unit, and select one Vehicle model in your unit that is within Engagement Range of that enemy unit. Roll a number of D6 equal to the Toughness characteristic of the selected Vehicle model. For each 5+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound (to a maximum of 6 mortal wounds).

lore: Be it cunning strategy, potent technology or supernatural ritual, there are many means by which a commander may hasten their warriors’ onset.
whenRules: End of your opponent’s Movement phase.
targetRules: One unit from your army that is in Reserves.
effectRules: Your unit can arrive on the battlefield as if it were the Reinforcements step of your Movement phase, and if every model in that unit has the Deep Strike ability, you can set that unit up as described in the Deep Strike ability (even though it is not your Movement phase).
restrictionRules: You cannot use this Stratagem to enable a unit to arrive on the battlefield during a battle round it would not normally be able to do so in.

lore: A hail of wildfire can drive back advancing foes.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Movement or Charge phase, just after an enemy unit is set up or when an enemy unit starts or ends a Normal, Advance, Fall Back or Charge move.
targetRules: One unit from your army that is within 24" of that enemy unit and that would be eligible to shoot if it were your Shooting phase.
effectRules: If that enemy unit is visible to your unit, your unit can shoot that enemy unit as if it were your Shooting phase.
restrictionRules: You cannot target a Titanic unit with this Stratagem. Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 6 is required to score a hit, irrespective of the attacking weapon’s Ballistic Skill or any modifiers. You can only use this Stratagem once per turn.

lore: Seeking salvation from incoming fire, warriors hurl themselves into whatever cover they can find.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Infantry unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, all models in your unit have a 6+ invulnerable save and have the Benefit of Cover.

lore: Even the most skilled marksmen struggle to hit targets veiled by billowing screens of smoke.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
targetRules: One Smoke unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
effectRules: Until the end of the phase, all models in your unit have the Benefit of Cover and the Stealth ability.

lore: Voices raised in furious war cries, your warriors surge forth to meet the enemy’s onslaught head-on.
whenRules: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Charge move.
targetRules: One unit from your army that is within 6" of that enemy unit and would be eligible to declare a charge against that enemy unit if it were your Charge phase.
effectRules: Your unit now declares a charge that targets only that enemy unit, and you resolve that charge as if it were your Charge phase.
restrictionRules: You can only select a Vehicle unit from your army if it is a Walker. Note that even if this charge is successful, your unit does not receive any Charge bonus this turn.

lore: High command has received new intelligence.
whenRules: End of your Command phase.
targetRules: One of your active Secondary Mission cards.
effectRules: Discard it and draw one new Secondary Mission card.

lore: Your battle plan is unfolding as you had foreseen, and the time to stake the fatal blow is almost at hand. Stay the course, and victory is all but assured.
body:
If you select this Gambit card, you have chosen not to attempt a gambit.
    
Until the end of the battle, you continue to score VP from your Primary Mission.

lore: The whole battle was a ruse to buy our covert kill teams the time they need to successfully complete a mission that could turn the tide of the entire war.
body:
DETERMINE DISTRACTION TARGET: Your Distraction target will be equal to half the number of enemy units that are within Engagement Range of one or more units from your army (rounding up) at the end of your fifth turn. If your Distraction target is less than 4, it is increased to 4.

DISTRACT ENEMY UNITS: At the end of your fifth turn, roll one D6 for each enemy unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more units from your army. Add 1 to the result if that enemy unit is Battle-shocked and subtract 1 if one or more of the units from your army that are within Engagement Range of it are Battle-shocked. On a 4+, that enemy unit has been successfully delayed.

DETERMINE GAMBIT SUCCESS: If the number of enemy units that have been successfully delayed is greater than or equal to your Distraction target, this Gambit is successfully completed and you score 30VP.

lore: Remaining in this battlezone is folly. Teleportahums are being sanctified and orbital transports are inbound to exfiltrate what forces remain. Prepare for immediate extraction.
body:
DETERMINE EVACUATION TARGET: Your Evacuation target will be equal to half the number of units from your army that are on the battlefield at the end of the battle (rounding up), including units embarked within TRANSPORT models that are on the battlefield. If your Evacuation target is less than 4, it is increased to 4.

EVACUATE UNITS: At the end of your fifth turn, roll one D6 for each unit from your army that is wholly within 6" of the centre of the battlefield, subtracting 1 from the result if that unit is Battle shocked. On a 4+, that unit (and any units embarked within it) are marked for evacuation.

DETERMINE GAMBIT SUCCESS: If the number of your units that are marked for evacuation is greater than or equal to your Evacuation target, this Gambit is successfully completed and you score 30VP.

lore: Remaining in this battlezone is folly. Teleportahums are being sanctified and orbital transports are inbound to exfiltrate what forces remain. Prepare for immediate extraction.
body:
At the end of your fifth turn, if one or more units from your army that are not Battle-shocked are wholly within 9" of a corner of the battlefield, and those units are not within your own deployment zone, roll 2D6.

Add 1 to the result for every other corner of the battlefield that has one or more units from your army wholly within 9" of it (excluding units that are Battle-shocked or within Engagement Range of any enemy units).

If the final result is 12 or more, this Gambit is successfully completed and you score 30VP.
